document.masterDocTitle: New species and records of Paraphloeostiba Steel, 1960 from China and Laos and descriptions of four new species of related genera (Coleoptera: Staphylinidae Omaliinae: Omaliini)

Remarks.
Omalium gayndahense
was originally described from Gayndah, Queensland , Australia ( MacLeay

1873). Bernhauer (1926) synonymized
Phloeonomus singularis Kraatz, 1859
with this species, but Steel (1960) revalidated and transferred it to
Paraphloeostiba
. Besides that, Steel reported records of
P. gayndahensis
from Queensland, New South Wales, and Lord Howe Island. Kuschel (1990) recorded it from New Zealand . Several authors in the 1990s recorded this species from Europe (e.g. Zanetti 1995 , Assing 1996 ), including the Canary Islands ( Assing 1996 , Assing & Wunderle 1999 ) and Madeira ( Assing 1996 , Assing & Schülke 2006 ).
Newton et al . (2000)
recorded it from California , USA . Rougemont (2001) reported it from Hong Kong , China . The same author reported records of
P. apicalis
from Hong Kong and Yunnan (see above), which in fact refer to
P. gayndahensis
. The aedeagus of a specimen from Hong Kong is illustrated in Figs. 25–26 . The species is here recorded from Yunnan for the first time.
